creator: niko@ontopia.net
text:
Jasper seems to instantiate a new JSP custom tag object for each
tag seen in the DOM of the JSP.  This tends to decrease performance
dramtically if nested custom tags are used and wherein other tags with
slightly complex constructors are contained (ie. in our case three
nested foreach loops [each iteration size < 20] leads to page response
times between 1.5 and 2.5 seconds).

If the generated _jspService() method would instantiate only one
object for each custom tag contained in the to-be-transformed-JSP
(like Resin seems to work) it would enable reusing the tag objects
in the further page processing.

I have also searched through the tomcat-dev mailing list and found one
thread (http://w4.metronet.com/~wjm/tomcat/2000/Sep/msg00631.html)
which proposes the same solution but could not figure out what the
status of this is.

creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
This is implemented, you need to enable it in server.xml ( disabled by default
since many tags are broken - they save state and can't be recycled ).
